org.mitre.mat.core
Class DocumentAnnotationTypeRepository

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Atype>
          org.mitre.mat.core.AnnotationTypeRepository
              org.mitre.mat.core.DocumentAnnotationTypeRepository
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Atype>
public class DocumentAnnotationTypeRepository
extends AnnotationTypeRepository

This is the document-level repository of annotation types. It has a pointer to all the Atypes allowed in the document. It also optionally points to a global (task-level) repository. If there is a global repository, types not found in the local repository will be copied in from the global repository as needed.

See Also:
Serialized Form

A version of findAnnotationType that accepts and an atype instead of a label; it just checks the hasSpan agreement. Create doesn't make sense in this case.

findAnnotationType

public Atype findAnnotationType(java.lang.String label,
                                boolean hasSpan,
                                boolean create)
                         throws MATDocumentException,
                                AnnotationException
Find the specified Atype within the repository. If you pass in create = true, the Atype will be created if not found. If create = false, it's a retrieval plus a check on the hasSpan agreement.

Parameters:
label -
hasSpan -
create -
Returns:
Throws:
